Base Types
Object
Implicit Singletons
Global, ObjectManager, Math, BitwiseOperations, DegreesManager, RadiansManager, RandomNumberGenerator


Overview

Models meta-data for a specific property of a specific object.


Properties

Methods

as_Byte().Byte

Returns the property as a Char. If the property is not actually a Char you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["unlikely_byte_value"].as_Byte )


as_Byte( Byte new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Byte. If the property is not actually a Byte you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["unlikely_byte_value"].as_Byte = 255


as_Char().Char

Returns the property as a Char. If the property is not actually a Char you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["first_initial"].as_Char )


as_Char( Char new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Char. If the property is not actually a Char you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["first_initial"].as_Char = 'A'


as_Int32().Int32

Returns the property as an Int32. If the property is not actually an Int32 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["lives"].as_Int32 )


as_Int32( Int32 new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Int32. If the property is not actually an Int32 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["lives"].as_Int32 = 3


as_Int64().Int64

Returns the property as an Int64. If the property is not actually an Int64 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["timestamp"].as_Int64 )


as_Int64( Int64 new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Int64. If the property is not actually an Int64 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["timestamp"].as_Real64 = time_ms


as_Logical().Logical

Returns the property as a Logical. If the property is not actually a Logical you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["dead"].as_Logical )


as_Logical( Logical new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Logical. If the property is not actually a Logical you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["dead"].as_Logical = false


as_Object().Object

Returns the property as an Object. If the property is not actually an object you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 local String name = actor.runtime_properties["name"].as_Object.(String)


as_Object( Object new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Object. If the property is not actually an object or if new_value is not instanceOf the property type you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["name"].as_Object = "Conan"


as_Real32().Real32

Returns the property as a Real32. If the property is not actually a Real32 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["f"].as_Real64 )


as_Real32( Real32 new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Real32. If the property is not actually a Real32 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["f"].as_Real32 = 0.2


as_Real64().Real64

Returns the property as a Real64. If the property is not actually a Real64 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 println( actor.runtime_properties["speed"].as_Real64 )


as_Real64( Real64 new_value )

Sets this property to be the given Real64. If the property is not actually a Real64 you will likely crash or corrupt the program.

Example: 

 actor.runtime_properties["speed"].as_Real64 = 2.0


name().String

Returns the property's name.

Example: 

 println( "Test".runtime_properties[0].name )  # prints: data


to_String().String

Returns this property as a "Type : name" string.


type().RuntimeType

Returns the property's RuntimeType.

Example: 

 println( "Test".runtime_properties[0].type )  # prints: Array<<Char>>


type_name().String (inherited)

Returns the true class name of this object. Implemented by the runtime; you should not override this method. Equivalent to calling "runtime_type.name" in the introspection library.

Example: 

 local Object obj = "Hello World"
 println( obj.type_name ) # prints: String

See also:

  • RuntimeType
